Pre-Game Insights: Guinea comes into the match with a positive recent record, winning three of their last five games and drawing one, with only one loss.
They haven’t conceded more than one goal in any of these matches, and all but one game featured fewer than three goals.
Senegal are in excellent form, winning four and drawing one of their last five games, conceding just one goal in the process.
They have demonstrated their offensive abilities by scoring 11 goals.
As the defending champions of AFCON, Senegal carries high expectations into the final group match, emphasizing their strong position and formidable team dynamics.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Guinea have remained unbeaten in their past 3 games.
Senegal are unbeaten in their past 6 games in all competitions.
Guinea have lost 3 matches against Senegal in their past five meetings.

Others: Guinea will face the absence of their captain, Francois Kamano, who received a straight red card in the 1-1 draw against Cameroon in the initial game.
Serhou Guirassy is uncertain for the match due to a hamstring strain, while Mohamed Bayo is expected to lead the frontline once again.

Senegal, on the other hand, may continue to be without defender Moussa Niakhite, who missed the second game due to an injury sustained in the first. Midfielder Lamine Camara and striker Habib Diallo could potentially be absent after sustaining injuries in the 3-1 victory over Cameroon in the last match.
Nicolas Jackson may earn his first tournament start in the forward position, and veteran Idrissa Gueye could be included in the starting XI to compensate for the team’s injuries.
